unnormalised: Social Media & Influencer Marketing News: Virality Trends!
normalised: Social Media and Influencer Marketing News: Virality Trends!

unnormalised: Hey folks, ever wonder what makes things POP online? The virality game is constantly changing! This week, short, relatable reels are still reigning supreme. Think bite-sized comedy sketches – remember Bhuvan Bam's early videos? Similar vibes, but shorter!
normalised: Hey folks, ever wonder what makes things P O P online? The virality game is constantly changing! This week, short, relatable reels are still reigning supreme. Think bite-sized comedy sketches – remember Bhuvan Bam's early videos? Similar vibes, but shorter!

unnormalised: Trends indicate a shift towards hyper-local content too. Videos featuring street food from Chandni Chowk or dance challenges to remixed Bollywood songs are blowing up. Influencers are capitalizing on this by collaborating with local vendors and showcasing regional talent.
normalised: Trends indicate a shift towards hyper-local content too. Videos featuring street food from Chandni Chowk or dance challenges to remixed Bollywood songs are blowing up. Influencers are capitalizing on this by collaborating with local vendors and showcasing regional talent.

unnormalised: Remember '3 Idiots'? The film emphasized practicality. Similarly, authenticity is KEY! Gen Z can spot a manufactured trend from a mile away.
normalised: Remember 'three Idiots'? The film emphasized practicality. Similarly, authenticity is K E Y! G E N Z can spot a manufactured trend from a mile away.

unnormalised: Analytics from IIM Ahmedabad suggest a strong correlation between user-generated content and viral campaigns. Basically, the more people feel involved, the better! One viral video of a chaiwala from Assam showcasing his unique tea-making skills garnered over 500k views in just 24 hours! So keep it real, folks! And maybe add a dash of garam masala for that extra spice! Keep an eye on this space for more viral updates.
normalised: Analytics from I I M Ahmedabad suggest a strong correlation between user-generated content and viral campaigns. Basically, the more people feel involved, the better! One viral video of a chaiwala from Assam showcasing his unique tea-making skills garnered over five hundred thousand views in just twenty four hours! So keep it real, folks! And maybe add a dash of garam masala for that extra spice! Keep an eye on this space for more viral updates.
